attributes.action: Extended theory test expiry date to 5yrs open test centres in southeast London
attributes.additional_details:
Extend theory test expiry dates opening test centres in SE London to
Reduce backlogs 
Reduced burden and costs
Increase flexibility for learners
Cost savings for learners

A restructure of the driving testing system given today’s current climate. The system needs to be diversified for
Disabilities 
Race 
Gender 
Age 

The system should mimic that of Ireland/New Zealand. With practical driving tests lasting 30 mins with 60-80%

Retaking theory tests every 2 years isn’t fair. 

Reforming is needed
attributes.background: Extended theory test expiry date to 5 years.as As practical driving test booking system has a backlog of over 600,000 people waiting to book a driving test the DVSA has a waiting list of 24 weeks. Open practical test centres in SE London as there are none this would relieve pressure on the DVSA.

rejection.details:
The UK Government or Parliament are not directly responsible for the opening of a new local test centre as this petition is calling for. 

You may wish to sign this open petition which calls for the two-year limit to be extended:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/735421. 

If you would like to call for reform to the driving test, you could start a petition setting out clearly what you would like Government or Parliament to do.
